00056 
00057 // instructions are submitted to the decoder as an array of strings;
00058 // the decoder fills the instruction object
00059 // default is the internal x86 decoder or a generic string-only decoder
00060 typedef int (*OPDIS_DECODER) ( const opdis_insn_buf_t * in, 
00061                                opdis_insn_t * out,
00062                                const opdis_byte_t * start, 
00063                                opdis_off_t length );
00064 
00065 typedef opdis_addr_t (*OPDIS_RESOLVER) ( const opdis_buf_t *, void * arg );
00066 
00067 enum opdis_error_t { opdis_error_unknown, 
00068                      opdis_error_bounds,        /* Bounds of input exceeded */ 
00069                      opdis_error_invalid_insn,  /* Invalid instruction */
00070                      opdis_error_max_items      /* Instruction > insn_buf */ 
00071                    };
00072 // default writes to stderr
00073 typedef void (*OPDIS_ERROR) ( opdis_error_t error, const char * msg,
00074                               void * arg );

00217 // set architecture and disassembler to use
00218 // if disassembler_ftype is NULL, the default for arch will be chosen
00219 // default is x86 at&t

00241 // instructions are emitted to handler; handler makes decision to continue

00249 // the decoder fills the instruction object
